meanings.definition: The practice or way of life of wandering from place to place.
meanings.sent1: Nomadism is common among certain tribes.
meanings.sent2: The nomadism of the Bedouins is well-known.
meanings.sent3: The nomadism of the penguins in the documentary was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her nomadism through the world of fashion was like a colorful tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The nomadism of the butterflies painted a beautiful picture in the meadow.

meanings.definition: The lifestyle of people who move from one place to another in search of food, water, and grazing land.
meanings.sent1: Nomadism was necessary for survival in the harsh desert.
meanings.sent2: The nomadism of the herdsmen allowed them to find fresh pastures.
meanings.sent3: The nomadism of the squirrels in the park amused the children.
meanings.sent4: His nomadism in the corporate world was like a strategic chess game.
meanings.sent5: The nomadism of the ants searching for food was fascinating to watch.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a nomad.
meanings.sent1: The nomadism of the refugees was a result of the war.
meanings.sent2: Nomadism can be a temporary or permanent way of life.
meanings.sent3: The nomadism of the lost dog in the neighborhood was a bit comical.
meanings.sent4: Her nomadism in the world of art was like a never-ending journey.
meanings.sent5: The nomadism of the clouds drifting across the sky was mesmerizing.
